reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: An outstanding book about a general I did not know a lot about. Very informative and interesting read. Thank you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What can I say! SB made this book come alive for me. My Rev War heroes were all there but her superbly built personal touch with all concerned made it for me. Nat and Caty will live forever for me as major players as well as Geo Washington in this pivotal story of American quest for independence. So close to failure so many times but always seemed to come through as manifested in the end. A top read in my history collection!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Needs an editor
reviews.reviewText: I have read quite a few books on the American Revolution, most non-fiction. This is a fictionalized/dramatized account of the personal life of Nathanael Greene mixed in with historical facts. I enjoyed the historical facts relating to the war, but I found the author's "romance novel" treatment of his personal life tedious. An editor should have caught the author's overuse of the phrase "his lambent blue eyes" (3 times by page 26, 13 times in total) along with the author's fixation on the phases of the moon (waning crescent, waxing crescent, waning gibbous, waxing gibbous, not to mention uses of full, and new). A red pen would have done the world of good in the review of a draft. What I did gain from this book is a great respect for Nathanael Greene's personal sacrifice for the Patriot's cause. The poor man does not receive anywhere near the respect he deserves. The author did an excellent job in conveying what our country owes to Nathanael Greene. But please get an editor that knows what they're doing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very interesting and easy reading.
reviews.reviewText: Love learning more about our revolutionary patriots. This is so well written!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Great Historical Novel
reviews.reviewText: One of the best historical novels since James Michener. It's not only a great story of the mostly forgotten Nathanael Greene (and many more) and his mostly unknown wife Caty, but is also great about the birth of the greatest nation, America, with all it's labor/growing pains.Best of luck along with James Dumas' highly entertaining musical GREENE, AMERICAN REVOLUTION'S CATY AND MAJOR GENERAL NATHANAEL GREENE to educating the masses on Nathanael Greene and how the war was won with so little and vastly outnumbered. People should know that Cornwallis' army was "ruined" before they fled to Yorktown.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Washington's Favorite General
reviews.reviewText: This was the best Historical novel that I have ever read. If you are a Rev War fan this is a must have book for your shelf. Packed full of facts wtitten in a way that makes you feel as though you are a participant in the trials, successes and failures of this great man and his fellow patriots as well as his family. It is a gripping page turner!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Painting The Revolution
reviews.reviewText: Many people don't realize how long the Revolutionary War lasted, and all the pain and suffering the soldiers endured. Greene was Washington's right hand man and most trusted advisor during the war. He was also a brilliant General, and he wore Cornwallis out making Yorktown possible. This book does a fine job of providing the reader of what the War entailed on a daily basis, and also of Greene and his Wife Caty as people.
